variant.question: In computer architecture, the software is defined as:

options.text: the physical components of a computer system.
the volatile memory (RAM, random access memory).

variant.question: For internal communication with the memory, the CPU makes use of.

two uni-directional buses for two-way communication.
four buses: two serial- and two parallel buses.
one bi-directional bus for two-way communication.

In computing, what is meant by the term multiprocessing?

options.text: Two or more central processing units (CPUs) are used within a single computer.
Two or more random access memory (RAM) structures are used for a rapid access to data and instructions.
Multiple tasks share common resources, such as a the same arithmetic and logic unit (ALU).
Multiple tasks share common resources, such as a the same central processing unit (CPU).

variant.question: In computing, what is meant by the term multitasking?

options.text: Multiple tasks share common resources, such as a the same central processing unit (CPU).
Two or more arithmetic and logic units (ALUs) are used within a single computer.
Multiple tasks are carried out by several processors.
Two or more central processing units (CPUs) are used within a single computer.

variant.question: In computing, what is the function of a control unit?

options.text: It ensures sequencing and co-ordination of operations.
